title: Learner Mental Model Analysis and Instructional Design for Understanding Plant Nutrition Concepts

context.prior_knowledge: High school-level understanding of foundational biology (plant structures, photosynthesis, etc.)
context.additional_context: Need for customized instructional design that diagnoses learners' naive conceptions and bridges gaps with scientific models

learning_goals: Learners can express their mental models of plant nutrition processes using phenomenological analysis techniques
Learners' conceptual levels (basic/intermediate/advanced) can be diagnosed through assessment tools utilizing item response theory
A customized feedback system can be designed and implemented based on analysis results
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
